Package jpass.crypt.io

Class CryptOutputStream

java.lang.Object
java.io.OutputStream
jpass.crypt.io.CryptOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
public class CryptOutputStream
extends OutputStream
Encrypts the passed data and stores it into the underlying OutputStream. If no initial vector is provided in the constructor, the cipher will be initialized with random data and this data will be sent directly to the underlying stream.
Version:
$Revision: 1.5 $
Author:
Timm Knape

  • Constructor Details

    • CryptOutputStream

      public CryptOutputStream​(OutputStream parent, byte[] key, byte[] iv)
      Initializes the cipher with the given key and initial values.
      Parameters:
      parent - underlying OutputStream
      key - key for the cipher algorithm
      iv - initial values for the CBC scheme

    • CryptOutputStream

      public CryptOutputStream​(OutputStream parent, byte[] key) throws IOException
      Initializes the cipher with the given key. The initial values for the CBC scheme will be random and sent to the underlying stream.
      Parameters:
      parent - underlying OutputStream
      key - key for the cipher algorithm
      Throws:
      IOException - if the initial values can't be written to the underlying stream

  • Method Details

    • write

      public void write​(int b) throws IOException
      Encrypts a single byte.
      Specified by:
      write in class OutputStream
      Parameters:
      b - byte to be encrypted
      Throws:
      IOException - if encrypted data can't be written to the underlying stream

      Overrides:

      Parameters:
      b - byte array to be encrypted

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Finalizes the encryption and closes the underlying stream.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Overrides:
      close in class OutputStream
      Throws:
      IOException - if the encryption fails or the encrypted data can't be written to the underlying stream
